Entries.default:
A massive door looms before you. The edges are sealed so tight, not a breath of air escapes them. 

Religious runes sprawl the length, carved deeply into pitted stone.
The door shudders and groans at your approach.
[Hold the Eel's Coil up to the door.]
A religious artifact, blessed by Berath, is likely necessary to open this entry way.

An elaborate etching spans the stone's width, carved faintly beneath several runes. 

It depicts a small crowd praying to a pair of giant eels that have coiled above a large door. An aumaua priest holds a disk near to the door's face.
As the Eel's Coil nears the door, the stone-carved circlet rattles in your hand. Wisps of your soul essence encircle the coil then reach outward.

The tendrils curl toward the door, touching it, soaking it in a purple glow. A murmur, like Berath's own welcome, whispers up from under your feet. 

The door begins to slide open, grinding down into the ground.
You recognize the runes as memento mori, depicting the inevitability of death and the immortality of the soul.

"Gibberish. Don't even bother." 

Maia shakes her head, frowning.

"Something about stepping into the jaws of Tangaloa with a full heart. Charming prospect, I say." 

TekÄ“hu examines the door, stroking his chin.
